title: 108_hr2674
content: The Act titled "Librarian Education and Development Act of 2003" provides loan forgiveness for librarians. The Librarian Education and Development Act of 2003 offers loan forgiveness for librarians who have worked full-time for 5 consecutive years in a qualifying school or public library. The Librarian Education and Development Act of 2003 provides loan forgiveness for librarians who have worked full-time for 5 consecutive years in a qualifying school or public library. Teachers can also qualify for loan cancellation under specific conditions related to their employment and subject area taught. The borrower must demonstrate knowledge and teaching skills in various subjects at the elementary school where they are employed. Amendments are made to the Higher Education Act of 1965 regarding student loan forgiveness for teachers and librarians. The borrower must have worked as a full-time teacher or librarian for 5 consecutive years in a qualifying school or public library to be eligible for loan cancellation under the Higher Education Act of 1965. The borrower must work as a full-time teacher in a qualifying school for 5 consecutive years to be eligible for loan cancellation under the Higher Education Act of 1965. Additionally, the teacher must be teaching a subject relevant to their academic major or demonstrate certification as an elementary school teacher. The borrower must work as a full-time teacher in a qualifying school for 5 consecutive years, demonstrating knowledge and teaching skills in various subjects, to be eligible for loan cancellation under the Higher Education Act of 1965. Amendments to the Act include specifying requirements for certification and subject relevance for elementary school teachers. Amendments to the Higher Education Act of 1965 now include eligibility for loan cancellation for full-time librarians working in public libraries serving areas with a high percentage of students counted under section 1113(a)(5) of the Elementary and Secondary Education Act of 1965. The eligibility criteria for loan cancellation under the Higher Education Act of 1965 now includes full-time librarians in public libraries serving areas with a high percentage of students counted under section 1113(a)(5) of the Elementary and Secondary Education Act of 1965. The eligibility criteria for loan cancellation under the Higher Education Act of 1965 has been expanded to include full-time librarians in public libraries serving areas with a high percentage of students, by adding paragraph (3)(A)(i) to include ``(J)''. The amendments made by section 1 of the Act will apply to any year of service completed after the enactment date.
